48 later and we are slowly starting to realize what just happened: Indiecon and Indiemagday. Boom! We had an absolute blast! And we did it  - we (meaning ALL of us) made Indiecon great again! It wouldn't have worked without each and everyone of you. Big and special T H A N K S go out to our supporters: Ganske-Verlagsgruppe, City of Hamburg, Medienstiftung Hamburg Schleswig Holstein, Hamburg Kreativ Gesellschaft, Optimal Media, Frankfurt Book Fair, Heftwerk, Papier Union and Fly Design Papier who made all of this crazy awesomeness happen.
Day 2 is about to start in half an hour. Here. 😍  For more photos, videos, out-takes and funny incidents, check our Instagram and our stories there: http://instagram.com/indiemags
Marcus Peichl (Leadawards), former editor of "Tempo" talks about the work with Hunter S. Thompson back then. Follow us on Twitter for further updates: www.twitter.com/indiemags
Follow these signs.

Welcome to #indiecon2016, Markus Peichl!  What is indie to you, Markus?  Markus Peichl already made media when some of us were not even born, but maybe all of us got touched by something he created. After working for Austrian public broadcasting ORF during his law studies, he became editor-in-chief of Viennas most progressive Zeitgeist magazine “Wiener” in the early 1980’s. Three years in, he got the call from Hamburg to develop a new publication for the German market. This one became a legend: “Tempo”. And that’s not even half the story. After the “Tempo” years, Markus Peichl started working as a TV producer and entrepreneur for German national broadcasting ARD and several private channels, produced music videos for Paul van Dyk, Run DMC, Falco, Xavier Naidoo and others, as well as developed magazine for almost all major publishing houses in Germany. He also hosts Germanys most influential magazine award, the “LeadAwards”. Since 2011 he heads the art gallery “Galerie Crone” in Berlin and Vienna, representing artists such as Rosemarie Trockel, Hanne Darboven and Norbert Bisky.  Meet him at Indiecon 2016 (www.indienet.de) and come to Indiemagday (https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/)

Welcome to #indiecon2016, Fabian Ebeling (Die Epilog)!  What is indie to you?   Fabian is a co-founder and editor of “Die Epilog“ which deals with contemporary cultural matters. The magazine is unconventional in many ways including the use of a seemingly wrong definite article in the title which makes every tight-lipped German grit his or her teeth. Despite being responsible for such far-reaching provocation, Fabian currently lives the dream of having two jobs, one as an editor at Bauhaus-University Weimar and one at “Kulturaustausch - Zeitschrift für internationale Perspektiven”. He also hosts the bi-weekly show “Canadian Content” at “Byte FM” and every now and then he goes for some freelance gigs for “Spex”, “RBB Kulturradio” or “Kreuzer” in Leipzig.  Meet him at Indiecon 2016 (www.indienet.de) and come to Indiemagday (https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/)

Welcome to #indiecon2016, Steffen Greiner (Die Epilog)!  What is indie to you, Steffen?  Steffen Greiner embraces the Berlin lifestyle of young male intellectuals including living in Neukölln, drinking too much and sleeping in. Apart from that he organizes all kinds of cultural activities and publishes journalistic and theoretical texts. His first magazine was called “Fensterplatz”, unfortunately the paper on cultural studies did not survive after issue four. Since 2015 he’s been an editor of “Die Epilog” besides his regular writing assignments for newspapers “taz” and “jungle world” as well as music magazine “Intro”. He’s also our favorite contestant for this year’s Indiecon bedroom eyes competition.  Meet him at Indiecon 2016 (www.indienet.de) and come to Indiemagday (https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/)

Welcome to #indiecon2016, Joachim Baldauf (Vorn Magazine)!  Joachim Baldauf is one of Germany’s most acclaimed fashion photographers. Since the 1990’s he’s been working for almost every imaginable relevant outlet, including an intense collaboration with iconic “Wallpaper” magazine in the early 2000’s. In many of his images, for example the recurring encounters with Eva Padberg or Claudia Schiffer, he seems to find intimate moments with the people on the other side of the camera, which makes them look natural and somehow more human even in extremely orchestrated settings. Together with designer Agnes Feckl he publishes “Vorn” magazine since 2004.  Meet him at Indiecon 2016 (www.indienet.de) and come to Indiemagday (https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/)

💎 Indiecon is a celebration of DIY culture. That also goes for the event itself. Our Berlin Die Brueder masterminds Malte and Martin did their part - and neither a lack of neon green color could stop them nor the special requirements of an antique folding machine. You can find the first issues of "Lakrimateur" at Indiemagday in the giant golden vending machine: https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/ 🚀🚀🚀

Welcome to #indiecon2016, Agnese Kleina (Benji Knewman)!  What is indie to you, Agnese?  You enter a room at an editorial design conference, there’s white shirts and dress shoes and there is the hat. A tall purple hat, and under it sits Agnese Kleina. From our point of view it seems fair to say that Agnese might well be considered a star in Latvia by now: As a copywriter and former fashion blogger (also known as “Whimsical Agnesiga”), but especially for reframing the view on the small baltic country through the invention of “Benji Knewman”. It’s not only the first english/latvian bookazine ever, it also reaches out to a global community of free spirits who want to live their life and not be bothered by conventions and expectations. And who apparently likes to wear purple hats sometimes.  Grab a ticket and meet her at Indiecon 2016 (www.indienet.de) and come to Indiemagday (https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/)

Welcome to #indiecon2016, Richard O'Mahony (The Gentlewoman)!  What is indie to you, Richard?  There is an almost mystic air that surrounds these publications: “Cos magazine”, “Fantastic Men” and “The Gentlewoman” are some of the most inventive and, at the same time, the most refined magazines that have come to pass in recent years. You just can’t shake the feeling that there’s a group of extraordinary people behind it you just want to be part of. Richard has been in the circle for quite some time as Senior Editor of “The Gentlewoman” and as a contributor to other publications of dutch creative uber-team Jop van Bennekom and Gert Jonkers. In Hamburg, he’ll hopefully give us some insight, too.   Grab a ticket and meet him at Indiecon 2016 (www.indienet.de) and come to Indiemagday (https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/)

Welcome to #indiecon2016, Ricarda Messner (Flaneur Magazine)!  What is indie to you, Ricarda?  Ricarda Messner creates the magazine probably everyone would love to make. In each issue, “Flaneur Magazine” discovers a street in a different city. It brought her to places like Rome, Athens, Montreal or Berlin and in close contact with the local artist scenes. With lush “Flaneur”, the versatile Berlin native set a high standard in materials and design quality – just to throw it completely overboard in her newest project. “Sofa” magazine is printed on sticky coated paper, stapled and claims that “Life is a Chatroom”, a witty reference to the hedonistic teenage audience it is made for. At Indiecon she’ll apply her understanding of taste and style to an interview with the makers of „The Gentlewoman“ – and hopefully she’ll also let us know what’s up next in her independent publishing house “editionmessner”.  Grab a ticket and meet her at Indiecon 2016 (www.indienet.de) and come to Indiemagday (https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/)

Welcome to #indiecon2016, Nelson Ng (LOST Magazine)!  This is how a magazine changes your life: It crawls up behind you as an idea you can’t get rid of and one day it just grabs you and takes over. Nelson Ng experienced this process with “Lost”: Born and raised in Singapore, he had already seen his fair share of the world after graduating from Pratt Institute in New York with a BFA in painting and moving to China to work as an Art Director at advertising agency Wieden+Kennedy. That's when “Lost” started closing in – as a side project at first and as a platform for people to share their travel stories. Three issues in, the magazine has taken over and Nelson is now fully concentrating on publishing projects. And as he says, there’s already the next idea in line.  Grab a ticket and meet him at Indiecon 2016 (www.indienet.de) and come to Indiemagday (https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/)

Welcome to #indiecon2016, Jeff Taylor (Courier)!  Jeff Taylor has all the air of a business man: White shirt, tight schedule, busy assistant. Originally a marketing executive by trade, he started Courier to build his own brand instead of solely giving advice to others. Among other things, Jeff used to be global Chief Marketing Officer for the telecommunication and technology brands of Hutchison Whampoa, one of the biggest companies listed in the Hongkong stock exchange. And he hasn’t severed all ties: The agency behind Courier also provides services such as consultancy, strategy and creation to other businesses.  Grab a ticket and meet him at Indiecon 2016 (www.indienet.de) and come to Indiemagday (https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/)

Welcome to #indiecon2016, Rosetta Lake Mills (The Lifted Brow)!  Rosetta Lake Mills is currently responsible for the outlandish beauty of “The Lifted Brow”, besides working as a designer for the City of Melbourne within their human centred innovation lab called CityLab. She has specialized in typography and publication design with a focus on the human perspective on things. We like that because we are humans – but also because the results just feel right. Rosetta also occasionally designs album artworks for musicians, which are great.  Grab a ticket and meet her at Indiecon 2016 (www.indienet.de) and come to Indiemagday (https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/)

Welcome to #indiecon2016, Sam Cooney (The Lifted Brow)!  Sam Cooney is a writer himself as well as publisher and editorial director of “The Lifted Brow”. He sent us a list of references that could fill a book itself – we’ll scrap that and just say: It is obvious that he’s at the heart of the community of editors, writers and artists that create the magazine. At Indiecon he’ll tell us what it means for the editorial process to rely on contributions by others and how he wants to amplify what “The Lifted Brow” can do by expanding into the book market.  Grab a ticket and meet him at Indiecon 2016 (www.indienet.de) and come to Indiemagday (https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/)

Welcome to #indiecon2016, Danny Miller (Human After All)!  What is indie to you, Danny?  In puff pieces on independent publishing you’ll sometimes read about “endless possibilities”, meaning you can do everything nowadays with just a laptop and a great idea. Well, that is one way to look at it. Danny Miller seems to take a different perspective: it requires structure (which Danny is - in his own words - basically obsessed with), clarity and a keen mind to carve out the exact medium that resonates with people. And he’s really good at it. While still at university, he developed the iconic film magazine Little White Lies magazine. As co-founder and CEO of Human After All, a London-based creative agency, he’s one of the industry’s leading voices and a member of the World Economic Forum’s Global Agenda Council on creative economy. Most recently, he launched a new four-year magazine project called Weapons of Reason – which addresses the pressing globals issues of our time in a very structured way.  Grab a ticket and meet him at Indiecon 2016 (www.indienet.de) and come to Indiemagday (https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/)

Welcome to #indiecon2016, Steve Watson (Stack)!  Do you love the feeling of receiving a present? To feel its weight in the mail while you carry it upstairs? To slide the fingers across the envelope and squeeze it to make out what’s inside before opening it? Oh yeah, we do love this feeling. And maybe that’s also the reason why we like Steve so much – because via his subscription service “Stack”, he sends us new and beautiful magazines every month. Well, of course that is not the only reason. Steve has been with the Indiecon from the beginning and besides being a distribution pioneer, he’s also a magazine lover, brilliant expert and just a great guy to hang out with.  Grab a ticket and meet him at Indiecon 2016 (www.indienet.de) and come to Indiemagday (https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/)
Fell in love with The Gentlewoman.

Welcome to #indiecon2016, Veronica Ditting (The Gentlewoman)!  Most of the time the cover of “The Gentlewoman” just consists of logotype and a subline, a portrait and a name. And with those little means, Veronica Ditting tells us almost the whole story. There’s the straightness and modernity of the typeface and layout which stands in stark contrast to the usual perception of a women’s magazine. There’s the genius idea to just use the first name to introduce some of the most stunning women in popular culture. Where other outlets might fall for the temptation to go all over the place with the (brand) names of their subjects, “The Gentlewoman” approaches the person on the cover on an almost intimate level: Hey, this is Kirsten. Hey, this is Vivienne. Veronica understands to work with the modest, conversational style of the magazine, which she shapes into new variations of her visual language in each issue – a quality she also uses in her work for “Fantastic Man”, “Cos magazine” and in the context of fashion and high culture.  Grab a ticket and meet her at Indiecon 2016 (www.indienet.de) and come to Indiemagday (https://www.facebook.com/events/1734113193467055/)

🌅 Get ready to ruuuumble: Indiecon is just around the corner! Grab your ticket now and meet the makers of fabulous publications. They come from Australia (The Lifted Brow), Canada (The Alpine Review), China (LOST Magazine), England (The Gentlewoman, Courier) Germany (Flaneur Magazine) and Latvia (Benji Knewman) and many more. Ticket sales end soon: www.indienet.de

Print lovers and mag makers, you're in Hamburg Sep 2-3? Rejoice!  There's still some Indiecon tickets left! Steve from Stack says: "... you’re going to get a really intimate experience, with parties, workshops and loads of chatting over lovely food." Yup. And: "The list of this year's speakers is ridiculously good."  Apply for a ticket via www.indienet.de

🎢 Print lovers, grab your markers and calendars, here's an event dear to our hearts that you should not miss: indiemagday is just around the corner so be there or be square! And for all of those who would like to sell their print stuff - oh happy day - there's still some slots left! You can apply for a stall via indienet.de/#indiemagday-apply.

Peeps is an indiemag tracking social shifts around the world. In deeply researched stories it offers engaging analysis and insight into contemporary human affairs. Issue 02 is titled ‚Crossing Thresholds’ and analyzes the rules of engagement once we overcome them. Enjoy reading!

Boat Magazine is a nomadic travel and culture publication that focuses on a different, inspiring city for each issue. Issue 11 is dedicated to the wonderfully complicated city of Havana, Cuba: It dives into the strict but passionate world of Cuban ballet, goes in search of lost Cuban recipes, spends time with the city’s artists and so much more. Happy reading! ⛵

📖🐛 Bookworms: attention, attention! Slightly Foxed is a literary magazine that puts its readers in touch with a world of interesting and often forgotten books through recommendations by booklovers from all walks of life - from celebrated authors, up-and-coming writers, librarians and booksellers, to the general public. Foxy!

Moin Moin – bald ist #indiemagday! Am Hamburger Oberhafen eröffnet zum zweiten Mal die "Free Trade Zone for Printed Goods" (Stockmeyerstr. 41, 20457 Hamburg). Kommt rum, bringt eure Magazine, Comics, Zines mit und alle Leute, die ihr kennt.  >>> Ihr wollt einen eigenen Stand machen? Hier entlang: http://indienet.de/#indiemagday-apply <<<  Am ersten Sonntag im September wollen wir mit euch die Magazinkultur hochleben lassen – und den Oberhafen in "Magazine Mania" verwandeln. Ihr könnt euer eigenes Heft präsentieren oder eure Magazinsammlung ausmisten, Magazinmacherinnen und Magazinmacher treffen und Heftberge durchstöbern.  Außerdem mit dabei: Kinder-Basteltisch, Happs und Schlürf zu fairen Preisen, DJ, Lese-Ecke und weitere noch namenlose Attraktionen …  Hier gibt's alle Infos und das Anmeldeformular für euren eigenen Stand: www.indienet.de  Mehr Infos zu teilnehmenden Magazinen, Stores, Ständen gibt es bald auf dieser Veranstaltungsseite und hier: Indiemags  Wenn ihr jetzt schon wisst, dass ihr es nicht nach Hamburg schafft, könnt ihr den #indiemagday auch online unterstützen: Besucht einen Magazinshop eurer Wahl, kauft euer Lieblings-Indiemag und teilt es online mit dem Hashtag #indiemagday. Inspiriert vom #recordstoreday und dem #indiebookday möchten wir unabhängige Magazine und ihre Macher hochleben lassen.  Der erste #indiemagday ist Teil der Indiecon – The Independent Magazine Festival 2016: www.indienet.de, ein Projekt von Die Brueder  ///////  Join the #indiemagday and our „Free Trade Zone for Printed Goods" in Hamburg’s „Oberhafen", Halle 4, Stockmeyerstr. 41, 20457 Hamburg. Let’s celebrate the diversity of independent magazines and their smart and fearless micro publishers.  >>> Ihr wollt einen eigenen Stand machen? Hier entlang http://indienet.de/#indiemagday-apply <<<  During the first Sunday in September, we transform a former warehouse into Magazine Mania. Find collectibles, hidden treasures and special offers. Buy, sell or swap mags, zines, comics and other printed goods.  There will be a huge collection of national and international indiemags – brought to Hamburg by the makers themselves and some of the most amazing stores in Germany. Come and experience books, posters, postcards and many big or small gifts made of paper. Come and dance, talk, eat and drink.  If you make a magazine of your own: Save your spot at http://indienet.de/#indiemagday-apply If you want to join us, follow this event and Facebook.com/indiemags.de   If you already know you can’t make it to Hamburg – don’t fret! You can still participate online and become part of #indiemagday. Just visit your local magazine dealer and buy an independent magazine, or find one you already own. On SEP 4, introduce the magazine online (take a picture, write a text or film a short video) and post it online using the hashtag #indiemagday.  Inspired by the recordstoreday and the indiebookday, we’d love to spread attention for independent magazines and the publishers behind the pages. So feel free to join us and spread the word.  #indiemagday is a project by Die Brueder and part of Indiecon – The Independent Magazine Festival 2016: www.indienet.de

Sidetracked Magazine is an online and printed journal that wants to tell stories of those who put themselves out there, who set aside fear and doubt in order to experience the breathtaking, the awe-inspiring and the magical. And - boy oh boy - it does. Happy daydreaming!

Moin moin Indie-Spirit! Sara Lisa will: Hamburg mit ihrem Projekt ABC bereichern.  ABC soll sein: Indiemag-Laden, Lesezimmer, Treffpunkt.  Ihr könnt dort: Indiemags anschauen, lesen, kaufen.  Finden wir: 👍 💰

Huck Magazine is Indie through and through: It celebrates people and movements that paddle against the flow. Rooted in the rebellious heritage of surf and skate, Huck wanders the globe documenting grassroots counterculture as it unfolds, seeking out freethinkers who are a wellspring of new thoughts and ideas. Right on!

Hey Hamburg magazine makers – today is the first time ever "Mag Friday" at Jan's place Gudberg Nerger. If you haven't checked the space out yet this is the perfect opportunity. And if you already know it you should come anyway, because fabulous Tristan from MC1R Magazine will be there and talk about his "Magazine for Redheads". See you later!

Fount Magazine is an indiemag about mash-up culture which examines the convergences of a globalized society and its effect on the creative field. For the current issue "plant a mountain", artists from all over the world sent their interpretation of the potential and courage we need to muster when we start something new.   To help you start your week right, we and fount are raffling off one copy of the current issue. Are you in? Just answer the question: "Every week a new start - what helps you get going?"  Conditions: http://www.indiemags.de/impressum/

Amuseum Magazine is crammed with original content taking a playful look at objects to find surprising stories about culture, design, history, science and art. In their latest issue, for example, ten pages are reserved for all things "now-on-a-roll" (pun intended) toilet paper and "the way the world wipes".

🐱 Meow. Kater Demos is a Berlin-based magazine focusing on politics, utopian scenarios and society. In its second issue, Kater Demos tackles questions like: Why are we getting less and less money, how do we attain the perfect work-life-balance – and where's the way out of our hamster wheel society?

Meet the talent, join the debate: intern is a bi-annual indiemag for and by the creative youth. Through a variety of perspectives, intern provides an contemporary platform for the ongoing debate about internships.  To lighten up your monday, we and intern are raffling off one copy of issue #3 ("the education issue"). All you have to do is comment under this post and answer this question: "What was your most ridiculous task during an internship?"  Conditions: http://www.indiemags.de/impressum/

'HOW ABOUT MAKING?' ist das Oberthema der ABOUT - Independent Publishing Fair. Am 4. und 5. Juni könnt ihr auf der unabhängigen Buchmesse in Mainz Kleinverlage und Selbstverleger kennenlernen, euch Bücher und Bookazines von den Machern selbst erklären lassen und Breaking Talks anhören. Wir sagen: HOW ABOUT HINGEHEN?

Fantastic Man pairs male fashion with in-depth interviews and portraits of men from all kinds of backgrounds. In its newest issue this Indiemag delves into the concept of home - and what it means to, well, fantastic men like director Pedro Almodóvar.   We're giving away one copy of the newest issue of Fantastic Man - all you have to do is comment under this post by answering this question: What does home mean to you?  Conditions: http://www.indiemags.de/impressum/

Reportagen is an independent magazine focussing on exciting, on-the-scene reports from all over the world - close to the protagonists and off the beaten path. In times where reports are perceived as a dying format because they are cost and time consuming, this magazine believes that good stories need time and extraordinary perspectives. And so do we. Happy Magazine Monday!

We just came back from PPA festival in London and are still on cloud nine! This year, for the first time, independent magazines were part of PPA. Thanks for having us, we had a great time talking about our perspective on independent publishing and meeting so many people creating unique indiemags with a strong vision. Stine and Steve from Stack summed it all up here:

'Empathy where it hurts' is the topic of Transform Magazin's second issue which has just seen the light of day. The magazine from Berlin wants to give impulses for social change without dictating a direction. Folks, enjoy your long weekend - it means extra time for reading indiemags and for thinking big thoughts!

🚀🚀🚀 Friends, fellow indiemag makers and print lovers: IT’S ON! Indiecon and #indiemagday are back – and we are already nearly bursting with anticipation... This year's focus is on pioneer communities within the world of print. We just launched our new festival website www.indienet.de, so please go check it out, sign up for our newsletter and mark the dates (2 - 4 sep) in your calendar. 🚀🚀🚀

To make your monday a little more bearable we and Schluck are raffling off one issue (#2) of the indiemag from Berlin. Schluck (English for "gulp") is a magazine about wine and its makers which dusts off the allegedly pretentious and grown-up world of wine. All you have to do is comment under this post and answer the following question: „What goes best after a bottle of wine?“   Conditions: http://www.indiemags.de/impressum/

Große Vorfreude: Nach langer Pause erscheint die fünfte Ausgabe von Die Epilog - alles ist wild und neu! Titelthema: Leben im Konjunktiv. In diesem Sinne: Wir wünschten, ihr kämet am Samstag ins HEFT!

Our bags are almost packed – we are leaving for PPA-Festival in London next week, talking about our perspective on independent publishing in- and outside the UK. Any crazy publisher/idea/magazine that we mustn't forget at home?

Mondays call for day dreaming and getting lost... LOST Magazine is a bilingual (English & Chinese) magazine about self-discovery through travel featuring real stories and epiphanies from people around the world. It is about immersing oneself in someplace entirely foreign in order to grow. The makers of LOST believe: Travel is a state of mind.

Mondays are for Magazines! “Ordinary” is a quarterly fine art photography magazine which takes a refreshing look at the mundane objects around us. Every issue revolves around one of these ordinary objects, which also comes as an extra inside the magazine. More Info:

PLEASE fasten your seatbelts. Here is Kai's giant beast of a blog post for Medium. 6500 words or pretty much everything you can learn about making a sustainable indie magazine (like Offscreen Magazine). We bow to so much indie spirit, Kai! Good to see some #indiemagday stuff there as well...

In diesen Minuten ist Druckabnahme. Seit Montag produzieren die #Indiecon2015-Summerschool-Studis (Universität Hamburg, FH Münster, HAW Hamburg - Wissen fürs Leben, HFBK Hamburg) ein Indiemag über den Hamburger #Oberhafen. Morgen wird es den Besuchern der Fachkonferenz vorgestellt und am Sonntag am Ort seiner Entstehung beim #indiemagday verkauft. Die Filmemacher Christian König und Gerrit Staron haben ein paar Szenen eingefangen - #indieforever mit FROH!

Und kress so: Da es keine verbindlich Definition gibt, was ein Indiemag ist, haben Brenneisen und das Brueder-Team eine eigene erstellt, die schlüssig klingt: "Die Chefinnen und Chefs müssen die Macher sein. Wer für das Geld zuständig ist, sollte Chefredakteur oder Designer sein."

DIE ZEIT so: Auf den ersten Blick ist es vielleicht etwas sonderbar, ein solches Ereignis in der Onlineausgabe einer Zeitung anzukündigen anstatt auf einer Litfasssäule oder einem handfesten Flyer. Aber: Seiʹs drum! Das Oberhafenquartier in der HafenCity wird zur "Freihandelszone für Gedrucktes"
Wir freuen uns, dass Tho von Coffee Table Mags zum #indiemagday kommt und Veljko euch nebenan Playground Coffee in die Tassen zaubert.

Ohne die Sofas und 100 Diskokugeln unserer Nachbarn Hanseatische Materialverwaltung und ohne den Situation Room der FilmFabrique, ohne die Heftberge von MAGASIN, Gudberg Nerger und Coffee Table Mags, ohne die überstarken Studis der HAW Hamburg - Wissen fürs Leben, der Universität Hamburg, der HFBK Hamburg und der FH Münster, ohne die "Villa Indie" der Ganske-Verlagsgruppe und Die Halle - Parkour Creation Center Oberhafen, ohne das Geese Papier, ohne die Heftwerk-Jungs, ohne die Druckerei Kettler, ohne den mairisch Verlag,  ohne das frauvorragende Catering von Smakuje - Vegetarisches Catering, Berlin, ohne die Beats von Cass. und Soundmassage Berlin, ohne die Neumann&Müller Veranstaltungstechnik, ohne die Gästebetten von 25hours Hotel HafenCity und Superbude St. Pauli, ohne den Alarm von Gestalten, Mit Vergnügen HH, Geheimtipp Hamburg und STADTLICHH Magazin, ohne die Taler der Medienstiftung Hamburg Schleswig-Holstein, der Hamburg Kreativ Gesellschaft und der Stadt Hamburg – OHNE – WÄR’ HIER DÜSSELDORF. Danke für die #IndieconSummerschool, die #indiecon2015 und den #indiemagday. Jetzt geht's los!

What is indie?  "Indie is a promise." - Christian Schiffer, founder of WASD - Texte über Games  Before former Greek Finance Minister Yanis Varoufakis was appointed, he used to tinker around with the financial system of gaming giant Valve. Yes, you've read it right: financial system! If the group were a state and the gamers on its platform the citizens – the nation would have double the population of Germany. To get to the point, gaming's a big thing – and Christian Schiffer is one of the few who knows how to communicate that adequately. In 2012, alongside his job with broadcaster Bayerischer Rundfunk, he founded "WASD", a bookazine for computer gaming culture. His publications are about indie games and mainstream games, but also about military simulations, for example, and the associated ethical issues. A few weeks ago, the seventh issue appeared. It's title translates into English as: "Love and hate - if you want to play, you have to feel". Immediate favourite sentence about sex in gaming: "Only the computer games, they're normally about as free and easy as a dog's tail caught in a door".  www.indieforever.de  Meet Christian at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823

This is about independent magazine makers. It’s about leaving your comfort zone and making something of your own. It’s about the indiemags that experiment with new and old ways in everything they do, from collaboration and organisation to distribution and networking. By focusing on the work and life models that fuel independent publishing, we’ll reveal how magazine makers create content and design with real substance. We'll talk about what it means to make a magazine and what the meaning of magazine making may be, and we’ll ask how it pays the bills.  www.indieforever.de
Die Katze ist aus dem Sack. Wir feiern am 29.08. eine #Indiecon2015-Aftershowparty – zusammen mit dem STADTLICHH Magazin und Motorbooty, der INDIE-Party im Molotow. Woop Woop!

What is indie?  "Turning the tables." - Johannes Conrad, art director of Flaneur Magazine  Flaneur magazine – the name reveals its great virtue: it combines the easiness of the casual stroller with clever observation and time for a special place. Johannes Conrad pours the multi-layered observations into a mould, together with Michelle Philipps, the other half of the Yukiko design office. The two have been working together for three years, often in collaboration with artists, photographers, film-makers and set-builders. The result is creations of enormous visual impact – and underpinnings for great stories.  www.indieforever.de  Meet Johannes at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823
Das STADTLICHH Magazin feiert am 29.8. (K)EINE Party? Das kann doch kein Zufall sein. #indiecon2015
Science Fiction Baustelle in der Brueder-Basis Kinzigstraße für die #Indiecon2015: Forever Indie!

What is indie?  "Working with people you like on magazines and books that are well done and worth being published" Daniel Beskos, founder of mairisch Verlag  Founder Daniel Beskos has already scooped tons of awards for mairisch Verlag’s programme and marketing. And it often goes like this: there’s Daniel on the podium in front of a crowd of suits with fat media budgets. If anyone asks what he’s invested, the answer is: 0 euros. One of his brilliant ideas is the Indiebookday, which he has organised annually since 2013. He was also the inspiration behind #indiemagday – Daniel, in turn, borrowed the idea from recordstoreday. He started in the mid-1990s with literature fanzines, today he takes hardcovers in high-end design to the people.  www.indieforever.de  Meet Ryan at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/
Wandzeitung #Iffi für den #indiemagday

What is Indie?  "The most possible freedom." - Julia Kahl, co-owner of Slanted Blog Magazine  There are magazines you want to read and there are magazines you want to lick, stroke, cuddle and take to bed. Slanted is definitely one of the most lickable magazines around, with an always unique look and feel. Julia Kahl is in charge of the constantly transforming design publication. She studied communication design at the University of Applied Arts in Darmstadt before she started to work at Magma Brand Design for Slanted Blog and Magazine as a managing editor. Since July 2014 she is co-owner of the company Slanted Publishers which she runs together with Lars Harmsen.  www.indieforever.de  Meet Julia at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/

What is Indie?  "When the topic is more important than the money you earn from it." - Chris Köver, co-founder of Missy Magazine and editor of Wired Germany.  Chris Köver is a journalist, feminist, activist and constantly dissatisfied with the social status quo. She is co-founder and publisher of "Missy Magazine", and currently an editor at "Wired Germany". Chris writes about politics, pop, technology and internet culture. Together with Sonja Eismann and Daniela Burger she also published three DIY-books for girls. In 2014, she spent three month in the New York headquarter of "Vice" as an Arthur F. Burns fellow – and now has a better understanding of what "Indie" can mean in a media context.  www.indieforever.de  Meet Chris at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/
die Hirschfabrik hat hier tolle Sachen gezaubert, zu sehen beim #indiemagday
Superstark, DIE EPILOG bringt pünktlich zur #Indiecon2015 eine exklusive Sonderausgabe heraus. Logisch: DAS PROLOG. Wir freuen uns drauf.

What is indie?  “When you do things differently from others – and can still pay your rent." - Juliane Schiemenz, editor of Reportagen  When you hold an issue of “Reportagen” in your hands you think: book. And just like a good book, “Reportagen” rapidly becomes your companion for daily escapes, into unknown worlds and formidable stories. On the other hand, you don’t have to summon up the same patience as for reading a novel – reports, says Juliane Schiemenz, are for impatient people, like herself. So is it a compromise? More of a new genre between book and magazine that has been popping up in recent years. “Reportagen” has always been a pioneer in this movement. As head of the German editorial office, Juliane’s mission will be to help establish the Swiss heavyweight and its newly infused form of storytelling in Germany.   www.indieforever.de  Meet Juliane at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/

Eines unserer Indiecon-Plakate hat es zu coverjunkie geschafft. Wir hoffen, dass Chefjunkie Jaap Biemans (u.a. Artdirektor von de Volkskrant) im nächsten Jahr (*knockonwood) zur Indiecon kommt. Danke Jaap!  ===  One of our Indiecon posters made it to coverjunkie. Would be ace if chief-junkie Jaap Biemans (Art director of De Volkskrant) could make it to next year's conference (*knockonwood). Thanks Jaap!

What is Indie?  "A trade-off: the joy of answering to no one, the horrors of bearing all the risk." - Alexander Scholz, editor-in-chief of HOLO  Alexander Scholz is currently doing what he wants. What he really wants. It is called "Holo", has more than 200 pages and focuses on art, design and technology. He characterises it as "an attempt to anticipate the future by exploring stranger, more fantastical themes". His line of work right now is somewhere between design, contemporary art and fortune telling – and it is more than intriguing to follow him on that path. You feel in every neatly designed page, in every tactile and distinct detail, that Alex is making the magazine he always wanted to read. "I'm still not quite over the fact that it's out and a reality now", he says – and carries a copy around all the time as if for reassurance.  www.indieforever.de  Meet Alexander at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/

What is Indie?  "Founding an indie now - probably both the craziest and the best point in time." - Ole Jendis, publishing director of IMPULSE  Ole is your man for the moolah: as the publishing director, he takes care of finance and marketing at "Impulse". His new favourite word is "strategy" – and that's something a lot of indiemag makers don't have, says Ole. His creed: with a clear goal, vision and idea for the mag, indie titles can be successful businesses – or at least pay their own print costs.  www.indieforever.de  Meet Ole at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/
♡ Three reasons why you should go to #Indiecon2015, by Steven's Stack:
Today we have a crush on the mega yellow Lowdown Magazine:

What is indie?   "Doing it anyway." - Klaus Neuburg, founder & publisher of FROH!  There’s a zoo living in Klaus’ wallet. If he picks a business card from it, the lucky recipient can decide between fish, bird or salamander – all of them printed neatly on uncoated paper with handmade embossment. This attention to detail is the stand-out characteristic of the work of Klaus and his friend and business partner Sebastian Pranz. They are the founders of an editorial and design office called (ha, ha!) Buero Zoo. They also publish “Froh!”, together with a team of journalists, photographers and designers. “Froh!” is a magazine about society, every issue focuses on a broad topic, for example “harvest”, “light” or “luxury”. The team also travels around the world to pass on their notion of independence to students and young magazine makers in Georgia, Moldavia and elsewhere.   www.indieforever.de  Meet Klaus at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823

What is indie?  “Complete control." -Jeremy Leslie, founder of MagCulture  Jeremy Leslie combines absolute indie authority with British understatement. His magCulture Journal site may be the most viable resource for people interested in independent editorial design, his books like Making Magazines and The Modern Magazine are already classics. When you meet him at a conference, though, it's likely he'll be holding a camera phone in your face to take a picture for Instagram. It may be due to his easygoing attitude or his unbelievable activity, but no matter where you look in the indie scene, Jeremy seems to be there. He brings along 25 years of experience in editorial design, with recent work ranging from creative direction of Fiera magazine to online publishing project Aeon via various consultancy roles including creative direction for Luxembourg’s Maison Moderne. He also runs the annual Modern Magazine conference in London.  www.indieforever.de  Meet Jeremy at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/
Neu bei indiemags.de: Noveaux - A magazine for fashion & green lifestyle // Berlin

What is indie?  “A unique point of view, without thinking about the target audience”. Mads Pankow, publisher of DIE EPILOG  Mads is everywhere. At least everywhere good. For example in YouTube videos of Martin Kohlstedt [ https://youtu.be/gZiMZclCjTI?t=1m7s ]. His own feeling for great stuff is also what drives him as publisher of “Die Epilog”. “Only if you keep straight to your own perspective will you find an audience that appreciates it,” says Mads. His magazine asks questions like: how do our society and our culture change? Do they change or are we stuck? What inspired him to start were “grumpy old men in the features section”. Ok, let’s go get ’em!   www.indieforever.de  Meet Mads at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/
Für Mit Vergnügen HH stellen wir künftig kleine, geile Indiemags und ihre  MacherInnen aus Hamburg vor. Zum Start haben wir Tristan und sein MC1R Magazine besucht:
Wir sind so in Form. Design Magazine:

What is indie?  “Indie is a word I have never used in my life. Magazines need punk.” - Bastian Schlange, reporter for Correctiv  Bastian Schlange is a reporter and the magazine man for “Correct!v”, the first non-profit investigative newsroom in the German-speaking world. What they’re about: they do in-depth research on a socially relevant topic, and then publish the hell out of it. Articles and pictures that are free-to-use for media outlets, books, graphic novels, films, websites, magazines – a finished project spans diverse media. Bastian is the expert for the magazine part. He is part of “Ruhrbarone”, a magazine focussing on stories about the industrial Ruhr area of Germany. He also founded the Wattenscheider Schule, an experimental project for unconventional undercover and Gonzo journalism. Born and raised in the Ruhr, he has worked as a freelancer for a number of daily newspapers, the Bild newspaper (know your enemies, right?) and the German Press Agency. In 2012, Bastian signed on with the Ankerherz publishing house as a blogger and author, writing down tales of old sailors (harrr!).  www.indieforever.de  Meet Bastian at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/

What is indie?  “The freedom to do everything you like to do, and having it under your own control”. - Tristan Rodgers, founder of MC1R Magazine  Redheads are one of the world’s smallest minorities, they make up about 2% of the German population – a pretty small target group for a magazine. Nevertheless, being a redhead himself Tristan came up with the idea of creating an art- and interview-based project about red hair in 2013. One year later he published the first issue of “MC1R – The magazine for redheads”, a collection of experiences that redheads had growing up – either positive or negative. Inspired by last year’s Indiecon, Tristan changed the language and format of MC1R in order to reach a wider, more international audience.  www.indieforever.de  Meet Tristan at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/

What is indie?  ”Getting to choose the people you depend on.” - Mathias Zeiske, editor of EDIT  “Edit” is a little bit like a friendly brain parasite. During its 22-year lifespan, it has had several hosts – for the past five years it has been with Mathias Zeiske. The magazine is what gets him out of bed in the morning, Mathias says. It features innovative contemporary writing, a whole diversity of literary forms, and translations. Interestingly, “Edit” is published by a non-profit organisation (Edit e.V.). It correlates with the book series “Volte”, which Mathias also co-publishes. And it definitely triggers the right receptors in the brain..  www.indieforever.de  Meet Mathias at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/
Indiecon 2015 - Summer School, Fachkonferenz, #indiemagday - das Slanted Blog Magazine hat unsere Machenschaften übersichtlich zusammengefasst:

What is indie?  “To decide independently what you want or have to depend on.” - Jan Spading, art director of the design and editorial studio zmyk  Jan is an art director who claims to have “more to do with journalists than designers”. And he likes it that way – it gives him special access to the written word that he designs in such a way that you can (and want to) read it. In 2003, Jan co-founded “Gee”, one of the guiding-light magazines on video games. He works for industrial clients, agencies and independent magazines. His editorial design work for “Dummy” and “fluter” has received several awards.   www.indieforever.de  Meet Jan at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/
"Indiecon, el festival de revistas independientes" - Kaum zu fassen, aber das Tapas Magazine aus Madrid kündigt die Indiecon 2015 an - samt überstarker Illu. ♥

What is indie?  “Indie is Shia LaBeouf’s rattail, not Kim Kardashian’s butt.” - Steven Gregor, publisher of Gym Class  Ok, let’s talk about what is indie. Steven’s response (see above) is maybe one of the most unsettling ones we ever received. Have you checked out Shia LaBoeuf’s rattail? http://static.thefrisky.com/uploads/2015/03/shia-labeouf-rat-tail.jpg Time for some explanation, Mr Gregor: “Indie is a frame of mind. It’s an intention… a voice different from the norm. Indie is risk.” Thank you. Steven is a London-based art director and editorial designer, he publishes “Gym Class”, a bi-annual zine about magazines and the people who make them. The title of the last issue read “nobody cares about your (oh-so-cool kickstarted tactile minimalist unoriginal) magazine”. It is great. He also maintains the “Gym Class” Instagram and Tumblr feeds, featuring the very best of contemporary magazine covers.  www.indieforever.de  Meet Steven at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/
Und danke PAGE!

What is indie?  "Indie is: creating alternative public spheres!" - Sebastian Pranz, FROH!  There is a mystery surrounding Sebastian. It is the mystery of the Spu. For some reason, people call him that. And if you get to know him a little, that’s also how he signs his mails. Spu. We don’t think it’s a reference to “Socialist Party of the Ukraine” (first hit on Wikipedia), but what does it stand for? Is it a secret identity? What’s the deal? Apart from exotic nicknames, Sebastian’s interest lies in the transformation of societies through media and journalism. After finishing his PhD in sociology he started working as a publisher and with Klaus Neuburg founded Buero Zoo, a studio focusing on sustainable corporate publishing. They also make “Froh!” magazine. Sebastian and Klaus understand their work as part of an overall design mission for society at large. Maybe that’s the mission of the Spu …  www.indieforever.de  Meet Sebastian at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/

What is indie?  “Exploit yourself instead of being exploited by others." - Philipp Köster, founder of 11 FREUNDE  Philipp Köster launched his indie career with a fanzine. Its circulation: 1000. Naturally, football was his theme even then – more precisely, Arminia Bielefeld, a team not exactly favoured by fortune. The idea may have been born of suffering, at any rate Philipp and his gang started early on to tell football in a different way. As a human story, with an eye for the little things that go on off the field and for the whole tremendous ecosystem that is football. In 2000, he founded “11Freunde” together with Reinaldo Coddou H. and nearly met his financial death from distribution fever. “It’s just not enough to produce good texts and visuals if you aren’t selling any advertising and the distribution side doesn’t work”, says Philipp. He therefore got publishing house Gruner+Jahr on board in 2010, they now own 51 percent of the shares. How much indie spirit remains?  www.indieforever.de  Meet Philipp at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/

What is indie?  “When it has to do with ourselves - and therefore with others."  - Michael Hopp, editorial office of HoppundFrenz  Last year’s Indiecon inspired Michael Hopp to start his own event series on (independent) publishing: his “Blattkritik Salon” has become a small but excellent periodical for magazine makers in and around Hamburg, featuring e.g. Bernd Runge with “Noah”, Ale Dumbsky’s “Read” or Max Dax, formerly of “Intro” and “Electronic Beats”. As one of the founders of the indie classic “Wiener” and an editor of “Tempo”, he is used to challenging principles of writing, thinking, understanding – a position he now tries to implant in corporate publishing with his editorial office Hopp und Frenz.  www.indieforever.de  Meet Michael at this year's #indiemagday: https://www.facebook.com/events/1608938849372823/

Our customer @mietzkotzi inspired us to do this post. It’s #fashionrevolutionweek and we encourage people out their to ask us and other brands #whomademyclother ? At Closed we like to produce our clothing at the source of where the materials originate. Europe is the focus for cotton yarn and fabrics. The best cashmere comes from China and our casual sweatshirts are made in Portugal. The denim for our jeans is woven, sewn and washed in Italy. Often made by second generation employees. Equality, friendly working conditions and fair wages goes without saying. Just like our designs emerge from a team, our manufacturers are members of the Closed family. http://bit.ly/29njgS1

Die Denkblase (1)  "Er wird arm sterben ... und einsam."  Was geht in den Protagonisten berühmter Gemälde vor? Bitte kommentieren!
Leinwand? Die ist Sebastian Burger zu nachgiebig.   Seine trockene, clean-sterile Bildästhetik resultiert aus einer anderen Material-Kombination.
Vallotton, Van Gogh, Cézanne, Bonnard: Früh sammelte das Ehepaar Hahnloser Spitzenwerke der Moderne.
Unsere Presseschau: Diese Woche über Kunst von Jim Carrey, den Instagram-Account von Cindy Sherman, den Urheberrechtstreit eines Affen. Plus kostenloser Ratschlag:
Hier ist Teil 3 unsere Videoserie "Kinder erklären die Documenta".   Vielen Dank an Josephina, Kalle, Acaycia, Ben, Henrietta, Ella, Mattheo und Emil!
Das Pixelquiz: Welches berühmte Werk suchen wir?  REGELN: 1.) Nur Hinweise, aber nicht die Lösung kommentieren! 2.) Wer es weiß: Liken oder teilen! 3.) Auflösung hier: http://bit.ly/2fEWVXS
Kunst in Gefängniszellen, Jesus-Castings und drängelnde Gläubige ...
Das Wort zum Sonntag.  Mehr Zitate zur Kunst finden Sie hier: http://bit.ly/2uwW8uj
Tobende Ozeane, geheimnisvolle Berge, spektakuläre Wasserfälle, zerbrechliche Blumen, speiende Drachen, unheimliche Geister - das waren die Themen von Katsushika Hokusai ...
Von den Postimpressionisten um Félix Vallotton bis zum Bildersammler Erik Kessels und Freunden. Hier sind die aktuellen Ausstellungstipps der art-Redaktion.
Herzlichen Glückwunsch Peter Eisenman!  Der amerikanische Architekt, der hier vor allem für seinen Entwurf des 2005 eröffneten Holocaust-Mahnmals bekannt ist, wird heute 85 Jahre alt.
Erik Kessels wurde durch seine skurrilen Bildergeschichten aus gefundenen Fotos zum Star der Found-Footage-Szene.
1976, heute vor 41 Jahre, starb Karl Schmidt-Rottluff in Berlin. Er war Mitgbegründer der legendären Künstlergruppe "Brücke".   Wie es zur Gründung kam und wer noch alles Mitglied werden sollte ...

Nächstes Jahr will Künstlerin Tania Bruguera für die kubanische Präsidentschaft kandidieren. Mit art sprach sie über diese Pläne, ihre erste Theaterarbeit und Kunst als Mittel politischer Veränderung ... Außerdem hat sie ein wichtigen Rat für Kunststudenten!
Heute vor 98 Jahren starb Ernst Haeckel.   Der Forscher und Künstler zeichnete die Schönheit der Natur wie kein Zweiter. Er schuf Huldigungen an ihre Vielfalt und ihren  Reichtum.
Albtraum oder Realität?   Roger Ballen, Großmeister des Absurden, möchte Bilder machen, die sich in der Seele festsetzen. Und das gelingt ihm!
Dürfen wir vorstellen: Andy Kassier – jung, erfolgreich, gutaussehend. Ein Traum.

Frühe Bilder von Andreas Gursky (z. B. das großartige "Pförtner, Passkontrolle", 1982) und Arbeiten von weniger bekannten Becher-Schülern sind noch bis Sonntag in Frankfurt zu sehen. Hier ist eine Auswahl der Bilder.
Ausgangspunkt der aktuellsten großen Arbeit der jungen englischen Künstlerin Hannah Perry war ein einschneidendes biographisches Ereignis.
Auf seinen Fotos dokumentiert Stefan Draschan das Aufeinandertreffen von Kunst und Museumsbesuchern.   Und diese Begegnungen können sehr komisch sein! Hier sind die Bilder.

Was machen wir hier eigentlich noch?  Der Kunstwelt fehlt es an Radikalität, sie ist inzestuös und selbstbezogen. Kritikerlegende Jerry Saltz wünscht sich einen Neustart. Aber ist die Szene in der Lage ist, sich selbst aufzurütteln?
Die meisten Teilnahmen, das längste Werk, der größte Aufreger – hier sind sechs Besserwisser-Fakten zur documenta.   Mehr zur Weltkunstschau lesen Sie in unserem art-Spezial: http://bit.ly/2vEAwj9
Heute vor 150 Jahren wurde Emil Nolde geboren!  Berühmt ist er für seine farbintensiven Bilder. Viele Ausstellungen feiern dieses Jahr den Jubilar. Ein Schatten jedoch bleibt.

Bubble-net feeding is a unique and complex feeding behavior engaged in by Humpback whales and Bryde's whales in Gulf of Tosa, Japan. It is one of the few surface feeding behaviors that humpback whales are known to engage in. This type of feeding is often done in groups. The group size can range from a minimum of two or three whales participating and up to sixty at one time.

Enjoy your swimsuit all summer long. We have gathered valuable tips, how your swimwear lasts for years.  1. Avoid throwing your swimsuit into the washing machine. Better hand washing and cool water. Water alone will not remove the chlorine or salt water, and laundry detergent can fade the color of some swimsuits, so we recommend baby soap free of fragrance.  2. Opt to flat dry it instead to maintain the suit's shape.  3. Do Not wrap your swimsuit in your towel. The towel has soaked up all of the chemicals and will continue to expose the swimsuit materials to their harsh effects.  4. Avoid Oil Contact - Oil based products such as sun creams and lotions can cause the elasticity in your swimsuit to break down causing your suit to lose its shape.  5. Rotate suits. Keep one or two extras on hand so that you can give the one you wore previously a 24-hour break. This allows the fabric to settle back into place, preserving elasticity.  #weareocean

Our Dino T-shirt, made from Organic Cotton & Seacell® is now on sale. Only a few left.

What's Seacell®?  We as a brand are interested in everything that goes on in the sea. Naturally, we are really eager to observe recent developments that make it now possible to produce yarns and fabrics made of sustainably grown algae (which means, that not more algae is harvested than is able to regrow).  Seacell – a material made of Tencel and Algae fibre – is one of those that are already usable.  Besides being composed of materials that regrow quickly, Seacell also has skin-caring properties.  To differentiate this special piece from the rest of the collection, we replaced our famous whale logo with a seaweed embroidery.  - 80 % organic cotton and 20 % Seacell®. - Regular fit.  - Hip length

Local production.  We think, local production is essential to guarantee the quality of our garments. In fact, we do not think that locality is an important factor when it comes to transport emissions, because many components of the garments come from far away anyways (e.g. cotton). However, through local production it is possible for us to regularly visit and personally quality check production sites and to establish closer and trust-based long-term relationships with our suppliers – we simply can be more transparent and assure quality standards more easily.  Read More https://twothirds.com/pages/sustainability-production-dos-and-donts

RE-USE  So, of course we hope that you will be happy with our clothes for a long time. But for many pieces, the day will come when you do simply not wear them often enough. What to do with the clothes then? Of course, in some countries there are good possibilities to sell your clothes online. In others, there aren’t. Furthermore, some people rather want to donate their old clothes. Some brands enable this to their clients by establishing a return option for used clothes. Those clothes, however, mostly are then brought or sold to local organizations that would get the clothes anyways, if you would give them to the charity collection bin. Blue Hole, Belize.  In 1836 the famous biologist-evolutionist Charles Darwin paid homage to these remarkable formations when he said the Belize atolls and the Belize Barrier Reef constitute “..the richest and most remarkable coral reefs in the entire western Caribbean.”  In the mid 1970s Jacques Cousteau’s Calypso made its famous investigation of the Great Blue Hole and the Belize atolls, which corresponds to the arrival of dive travel to the region.

*Turning a shark finning camp into a shark nursery.* Great initiative from our friends @mission blue in partner with @misool foundation.  Misool’s marine reserve is almost twice the size of Singapore and hosts a sanctuary for baby sharks. When this area was discovered in 2005, it was grounds for shark finning and heavy marine extraction. Learn how one determined community has worked tirelessly for over a decade to turn Misool into a conservation success story! Learn more in Ocean Stories [VIDEO]: http://bit.ly/2lHNbhB #DivetheWorld #NoBlueNoGreen #HopeSpots #SylviaEarle

First underwater video of True's baked whales.  The video reveals that True's beaked whales can travel in small groups. In this case, the group consisted of three to four adult females or juveniles. The whales forage using suction or grabbing, so only adult males have teeth. Researchers suspect that males use the teeth in fights and assertive displays, similar to how male deer brandish their large horns.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Km5hiC2bESA

Mass Ray Migration: A Phenomenon That Will Make Your Hairs Stand.  Measuring up to 6ft 6in across, poisonous golden cow-nose rays migrate in groups  -  or 'fevers'  -  of up to 10,000 as they glide their way silently towards their summer feeding grounds. They migrate twice yearly: north in late spring (as pictured here) and south in late autumn.   Photo: Sandra Critelli

"Rare image of a shark stepping on a Lego." The story behind this Famous Meme from Robert Petersen (https://twitter.com/Sonikku_a/status/781469409281921024/photo/1?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)  The original shark photo was taken in January by Mike Coots, himself a shark attack survivor and now an avid advocate for the creatures. Despite losing a leg to a tiger shark in 1997 when he was a teenager, Coots now uses his photography to encourage protection of sharks, speaking out against the shark-fin trade and sharing shark photos on his Instagram account.  "I took my girlfriend as a surprise Christmas present on a shark dive off of Stewart Island in New Zealand where the pic was taken," Coots said. "It was on a GoPro on a long wooden dowel on the 0.5 sec timer mode. The shark was doing what was called 'gaping' (a shark-communication behavior) and I happened to capture it."

Escape from Monday, for a while.  Marietas Islands Hidden Beach, Nayarit Mexico.  They were originally formed many thousands of years ago by volcanic activity, and are completely uninhabited. The islands are about an hour long boat ride west-northwest from the coast of Puerto Vallarta and are visited daily by hundreds of tourists, yet no one can legally set foot on the islands. In the early 1900s the Mexican government began conducting military testing on the islands because no one lived there. Many bombings and large explosions took place on the islands causing caves and rock formations to be created. After a massive international outcry, started by scientist Jacques Cousteau in the late 1960s, the government eventually decided to label the islands a national park and therefore protected against any fishing, hunting or human activity.  Situated in a sort of open sun-drenched crater, this beach is affectionately nicknamed the "hidden beach" or "beach of love" (Playa del Amor), it is accessible only when the tide is low.

GOAL 14: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources.  On September 25th 2015, countries adopted a set of goals to end poverty, protect the planet, and ensure prosperity for all as part of a new sustainable development agenda. Each goal has specific targets to be achieved over the next 15 years. For the goals to be reached, everyone needs to do their part: governments, the private sector, civil society and people like you.  Do you want to get involved? You can start by telling everyone about them. We’ve also put together a list of actions that you can take in your everyday life to contribute to a sustainable future.   Via United Nations http://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/oceans/  #weareocean

Tylko's launching at the London Design Festival.  If you are eager to know more about Tylko's furniture revolution and the collaboration with Yves Béhar please join us for a keynote discussion:  Topic: Yves Béhar and Tylko founders talk about the future of design When: 24 September, 7pm Where: Auditorium at designjunction The College 12 Southampton Row, London WC1B 4AE, UK  Always bespoke. Never ordinary.  Born to give people their choice back, Tylko provides custom, high-quality designer furniture in a simple, modern way. Co-create unique pieces with world-class designers, adapt them by touch, visualize them live in your space, and purchase straight from the factory – all from the palm of your hand.   Explore the app today, and discover a revolutionary new approach to furniture design.  During London Design Festival Tylko will introduce 3 new customisable products:  The Hub Table - every user is entitled to co-design the piece with Yves Béhar.  The Totem Mill - salt and pepper mill with 42 billion possible combinations designed by talented Polish designer Krystian Kowalski.  The Ivy Shelf - shelf that can be customized to meet the most exacting standards and spaces. Designed by in-house Tylko team.  Be the first to co-design your own furniture with Tylko. Visit Tylko space at designjuntion, meet the team, speak with the designers and get creative with our app.   Tylko. Yours by design.
